items.title: How One German Toymaker Made Money Despite U.S. Tariffs
items.description: A combination of strategic planning, good timing and a long-awaited product helped the maker of electronic story boxes weather the onset of tariffs.

items.title: Why Are Guards Using Force More Often in New York’s Prisons?
items.description: State prison guards say they are doing so because their jobs have become more dangerous. A New York Times analysis points to a different reality.

items.title: Dharmendra, Bollywood Leading Man, Dies at 89
items.description: In a career spanning nearly seven decades and more than 300 productions, the actor became one of India’s best known and most versatile screen stars.

items.title: Jimmy Cliff, Reggae Icon, Dies at 81
items.description: The Grammy Award-winning singer and star of the movie “The Harder They Come” died of pneumonia, his wife said.

items.title: His Right Foot: One Tiny Drawing for Sale, Maybe by Michelangelo
items.description: The Renaissance artist painted more than 100 figures in the Sistine Chapel ceiling, yet studies for only a handful remain. Could this five-inch drawin...
